messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion]was: Mean Women , now: more conference stuff
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 1/13/04 8:54:20 AM, danielle.conger@comcast.net writes:  I was on my way
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 1/13/04 8:54:20 AM, danielle.conger@... writes:

<< Sandra, I take it your broken leg occurred AT the conference? >>

I was on my way to where I was going to speak, in about 15 minutes. I had my
notes and the things for the auction. VERY very frustrating to think
about even now.

Sandra

messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion]was: Mean Women , now: more conference stuff
messages.msgSnippet: Thanks for posting this! The more I read, the more I *know* I want to be there. Sandra, I take it your broken leg occurred AT the conference? I had tears in my
messages.messageBody:
Thanks for posting this! The more I read, the more I *know* I want to be there.

Sandra, I take it your broken leg occurred AT the conference? I had tears in my eyes reading about Marty speaking out in your place at the conference. What an incredible moment!

--danielle
Kelli wrote:
Here are some accounts from people who went to the 2002 conference:

http://www.schoolsoutsupport.org/testimonials.html

I didn't go to that one, but I went to the 2003 one.

It was awesome. Really. To be with so many other unschoolers was such an
amazing experience. Very cool.

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion]was: Mean Women , now: more conference stuff
messages.msgSnippet: From: Wendy Carr  **What happenes at the Conf?** ******************************** Here are some accounts from people who went to the 2002
messages.messageBody:
From: "Wendy Carr" <WendyWCarr@...>

**What happenes at the Conf?**
********************************
Here are some accounts from people who went to the 2002 conference:

http://www.schoolsoutsupport.org/testimonials.html

I didn't go to that one, but I went to the 2003 one.

It was awesome. Really. To be with so many other unschoolers was such an
amazing experience. Very cool.

We drove down from Minnesota, to South Carolina. It was so worth it.

My kids comments about going this year, "we ARE going!"

We'll be there again.

Here's the link for this year's: http://www.liveandlearnconference.org/

Kelli~ mouthpiece for Kathryn <g>
